sub_topic: Determine the Hopf map of a manifold.
message_1: Consider the manifold $\mathbb{S}^3$ as the set of points $(z_1,z_2)$ in $\mathbb{C}^2$ such that $|z_1|^2 + |z_2|^2 = 1$. Determine the Hopf map $h: \mathbb{S}^3 \rightarrow \mathbb{S}^2$ defined by $h(z_1,z_2) = (2|z_1|^2 - 1, 2\text{Re}(z_1 \bar z_2), 2\text{Im}(z_1 \bar z_2))$. Find the image of $(1,0)$ under this Hopf map.
message_2:
To find the image of the point (1, 0) under the Hopf map, we simply plug in the values of $z_1$ and $z_2$ into the definition of the Hopf map:

$h(z_1, z_2) = (2|z_1|^2 - 1, 2\text{Re}(z_1 \bar z_2), 2\text{Im}(z_1 \bar z_2))$

For the point (1, 0), we have $z_1 = 1$ and $z_2 = 0$. Therefore, we get:

$h(1, 0) = (2|1|^2 - 1, 2\text{Re}(1 \cdot \bar 0), 2\text{Im}(1 \cdot \bar 0))$

Since $|1|^2 = 1$ and $\bar 0 = 0$, we can simplify this to:

$h(1, 0) = (2 \cdot 1 - 1, 2 \cdot 0, 2 \cdot 0)$

So, the image of the point (1, 0) under the Hopf map is:

$h(1, 0) = (1, 0, 0)$
